channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Top two executives at City & Guilds placed on leave
item.description: Pair will be absent ‘for short period’ from vocational trainer, whose charity is under investigation by Charity Commission The top two executives at C...

item.title: Extreme rainfall inundates South Africa and Mozambique
item.description: Flood warning raised to highest level with roads washed away and rain forcing evacuation of Kruger national park Large areas of north-eastern South Af...

item.title: Jenrick’s replacement admits Tories ‘let down’ the country but says public are sick of ‘backstabbing’ – UK politics live
item.description: The new shadow justice secretary Nick Timothy said he was ‘sorry’ for how the Conservatives ‘handled certain things in those last few years’ in power ...

item.title: Early results show Museveni leading Uganda election amid reports of violence
item.description: Veteran president holding off main challenger Bobi Wine after campaign marred by violence at opposition rallies The veteran Ugandan president, Yoweri ...

item.title: White House claims ‘acquisition of Greenland’ is purpose of working group – Europe live
item.description: Denmark’s foreign secretary has denied the assertion and since reiterated that discussion over territory is a red line. Shaheen then strikes a slightl...

item.title: China and Canada announce tariffs relief after a high-stakes meeting between Carney and Xi
item.description: Canola oil and electric cars are at the centre of the deal agreed by Mark Carney and Xi Jinping after years of strained ties.

item.title: Two people aged 90 die in north London house fire
item.description: A man and woman were found in a burning house in Barnet, north London in the early hours of Friday.

item.title: Julio Iglesias denies sexual assault allegations
item.description: In a statement, the Spanish singer says the allegations are "absolutely false and deeply sadden me".

item.title: Weight loss jabs are 'opportunity' for Leon, boss says
item.description: John Vincent says the chain could benefit from the weight loss trend, and sets out his plans to revive the business.

item.title: 'Cautiously optimistic' or 'no progress'? - players divided on Slam demands
item.description: As players demand greater reward from the Grand Slams, some are optimistic about progress. Others are not so sure.
